main_definition: Sleep is a natural, recurring state of rest for the mind and body, characterized by reduced consciousness, inactivity, relaxation of muscles, and diminished sensory activity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be unconscious or not aware
meanings_and_examples.example: After a long day, he fell into deep sleep without realizing the time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A period of resting for the body and mind to recover
meanings_and_examples.example: She needed a good night's sleep after working overtime all week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression referring to an extended or lengthy duration of this state
meanings_and_examples.example: I was in deep sleep for hours, unable to wake up even when my alarm went off.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To plan and organize a person's day-to-day activities
meanings_and_examples.example: Let's get some sleep tonight so we can restock our plans tomorrow for the weekend.
